intro: Galeobdolon szechuanense, commonly known as the Sichuan galeobdolon, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes, often in forest understories. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in complex umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the need for conservation efforts in its native range.
